member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to html element which renders track bar.

remarks.p: That class is merged with AppStyling css class igsli_TrackH or igsli_TrackV depending on orientation of slider.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.EditorControls.SliderTrackCssClasses.ValueFillCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to html element which renders part of track bar located between edge of track and main thumb.

remarks.p:
In case of horizontal orientation that is part of track located on the left side from the thumb.
In case of vertical orientation that is part of track located below the thumb.
In case of both thumbs that is part of track located between thumbs.
That class is merged with AppStyling css class igsli_TrackValueH or igsli_TrackValueV depending on orientation of slider.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.EditorControls.SliderTrackCssClasses.SecondaryValueFillCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class applied to html element which renders left edge of track bar for horizontal slider or bottom edge of track bar for vertical slider when FillValueMode is set to All and EnableSecondaryValue of WebSlider is enabled.

remarks.p: That class is merged with AppStyling css class igsli_TrackValue2H or igsli_TrackValue2V depending on orientation of slider.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.EditorControls.SliderTrackCssClasses.MarginCssClass
member.summary: Gets sets the custom css class responsible for margins between increment/decrement buttons and slider track.

remarks.p: That class is merged with AppStyling css class igsli_MarginH or igsli_MarginV depending on orientation of slider.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.EditorControls.SliderTrackCssClasses.HoverCssClass

remarks.p: That class is merged with CssClass and AppStyling css class igsli_TrackHover.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.EditorControls.SliderTrackCssClasses.FocusCssClass

remarks.p: That class is merged with CssClass and AppStyling css class igsli_TrackFocus.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataSourceAdapter.GetRecordCount
member.summary: Provides the number of records in the data source. This is the total number of records in the data source.
member.remarks: Default implementation always returns -1. If a derived class is able to quickly determine number of records the method must be overriden and the number returned. Otherwise there is no need to override the method as the will determine the number on its own.
member.returns: Number of records in the data source.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataSourceAdapter.GetRecordViewCount
member.summary: Provides the number of records that are currently requested. This number takes into account paged data.
member.remarks: Default implementation always returns -1. If a derived class is able to quickly determine number of records the method must be overriden and the number returned. Otherwise there is no need to override the method as the will determine the number on its own.
member.returns: Number of records in the current view.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataBot
member.summary: Abstract base class for managing the databinding process for controls. Derived classes must override the DataBind method and will most likely need to override both PerformDataSelection and PerformDataBinding methods to carry out the necessary tasks. The EnumDataBot derivation contains the logic for enumerating the data source and populating control objects with data.

member.summary: Changes a value to any type, including Nullable ones.

Type to convert to.
member.returns: Converted value.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.EnumDataBot
member.summary: The EnumDataBot class is the workhorse class for databinding. This is due to the fact that all .NET databinding operations come down to enumerating a collection of data objects and extracting the values from the properties of each object. So this class inherits from DataBot to implement the basic databinding behavior.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataRecordCollection
member.summary: Collection of the objects. The objects wrap up original data records and provide a convenient way of getting the data and enumerating though them.
member.remarks: The simplest of the data records collections implemented in the namespace. Assumes that all data manipulation is done by the data source. It simply iterates through available records and provides acces to those via an enumerator.

member.summary: Costructs the collection and initializes its owner data adapter reference.
member.param: Reference to the object that owns the collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.Data.DataRecordCollection.GetOriginalEnumerator
member.summary: Returns the original enumerator of the records in the data source.
member.returns: The original enumerator of the records in the data source.
member.remarks: The method can be used to get original enumerator and do a quick walk through of the data records without invloving more complicated mechanism of data management implemented by the object. The order of records in the enumerator always corresponds to the order of records in the original data source. Using the enumerator returned by this method will help to improve performance and save memory.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase
member.summary: Foundation class from which many other classes within the framework are derived. ObjectBase can be considered a light-weight verion of the System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl class. It is used to represent various objects within the context of a larger WebControl. One of the primary responsibilities of ObjectBase is to maintain ViewState and provide methods for interacting with ViewState. The Property Get methods and Property Set method are used to simplfy and channel property access through a single mechanism. A variation of the ObjectBase class is the ControlObject. The ControlObject class provides similar functionality except that it is derived from the System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl base class and is used in situations where that is required.
member.remarks: The GetValue() and SetValue() methods of this class provide access to ViewState and ClientState for derived classes to store properties that must persist between page postbacks. SetValue methods that use a string id are saved to ViewState while SetValue methods that use an integer index are saved to ClientState. Similarly, GetValue methods will retrieve from ViewState or ClientState according to the type of the first paramter: string for ViewState and integer for ClientState.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase.SaveClientStateToViewState
member.summary: If the control is not visible, we don't want to loose our ClientState during the next postback, so lets store it in ViewState.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase.LoadClientStateFromViewState
member.summary: Checks to see if ClientState was saved into Viewstate, if so, then it loads.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase.Infragistics#Web#UI#IObjectBase#FullAddress
member.summary: The FullAddress property returns a string value containing a complete description of the object within the object model of the control. Derived class must override this property if the object will be sent to the client.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase.ViewState
member.summary: Property to return the ViewState bag for the object. If none exist, then one is created.
member.remarks: This property should not be accessed to check for the existance of ViewState since ViewState will be created if none exists. Instead, use IsDataPossible() or IsDirty() to check if there are items in ViewState.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase.System#Web#UI#IStateManager#IsTrackingViewState
member.summary: Interface method for testing if tracking ViewState. This method calls the virtual method of the same name to carry out the operation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase.IsTrackingViewState
member.summary: This method returns a boolean value which indicates whether ViewState is being tracked for the object. Once viewstate is being tracked, all property changes are roundtripped from server to client and back within the ViewState hidden field.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase.IsEmpty
member.summary: Checks if ViewState has any property with not a default value. This property should be overriden by extended class when additional subobjects are supported. IsEmpty will then check each subobject and return a value based on the check of those objects plus itself.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectBase.PropCount
member.summary: This property is used to track the number of properties this object is sending to ClientState. Each derived class overrides this property to indicate the new total of properties. The number consists of the PropCount value of the base class plus the number of ClientState properties utilized by each derived class.

member.param: Target writer
True: vertical bar, false: horizontal
Image for corners
Image for top and bottom edges if bar is horizontal, or left and right edges if bar is vertical.
Size of corner in pixels. It depends on size of image. It also limits minimum width of horizontal bar and max width of vertical bar. Recommended value is 8-14.
True: render only left edge of vertical bar, or top edge of horizontal bar. False: render only right edge of vertical bar, or bottom edge of horizontal bar.

member.summary: Render only half of vertical or horizontal image (appearance like a tab). It RenderingType is full then that property has no effect. If RenderingType is vertical and property is True, then only left side of image is rendered. If RenderingType is vertical and property is False, then only right side of image is rendered. If RenderingType is horizontal and property is True, then only top side of image is rendered. If RenderingType is horizontal and property is False, then only botom side of image is rendered.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot
member.summary: The RunBot class is a companion to the main control class of a companion. It's primary function is to offload control functionality so that the main control is free to inherit from any other control class in the ASP.NET framework. Since the main control object is a rather heavy object, it is best to put as much functionality into base classes so that it can be shared and reused. But if the main control object must inherit from a base class other than one defined in the framework, then it would not be able to participate in the framework without duplicating a great deal of code. Therefore, by offloading the majority of functionality from the control object itself to a RunBot derivation class, the framework logic can be kept in the RunBot and the control can derive from any base class it needs to.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.UIObject
member.summary: The UIObject class implements basic functionality appropriate to an object that will be represented in the user interface and which the user may choose to interact with. This functionality closely parrallels that of the ControlObject class where the main difference is that the UIObject derives from ObjectBase and not from WebControl. This makes the UIObject class a light weight object that still possesses the necessary capabilities for rendering elements of the control such as collections of objects that need to have a low memory footprint and yet are still offer high performance.

member.param: The string Id value for the control to be located.
member.returns: If a control is located within the TemplateContainer of this UIObject that matches the passed in Id, the control reference is returned. Otherwise null is returned.
member.remarks: The TemplateContainer is tagged with the INamingContainer interface. So the Id passed to this method must match the Id of a control within that NamingContainer.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling
member.summary: This interface is implemented by controls that support Application Styling.

remarks.p: Infragistics ASP.NET controls implement this interface to interoperate with the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) that provides application developers and graphic designers an easy way of collaborating to bring a consistent appearance to the user interface elements of their Web applications.
This interface features a single defaultable boolean property allowing a control to participate in or opt-out of the ASF.

The consistent appearance is defined by a set of cascading style sheets (CSS) files, and graphic images, created by graphic designers. The collection of these files are referred to as a style set. The , and properties of this interface enable ASF to locate and resolve these files.
Controls participating in ASF must initialize their Style objects when the framework calls their control back by implementing the method.

Application styles rendered at design-time must be loaded from the external style sheet (*.css) files, otherwise the control may not appear properly styled within the Integrated Development Environment (IDE). The property contains these design-time style definitions, and the method is called by the ASF to indicate when cached style definitions have become invalid and must be reparsed.

The class is provided by ASF to simplify many requirements of implementing the IProvideAppStyling interface. Controls implementing this interface should keep an instance of WebAgent internally, and use it to register themselves with ASF, and to store the properties of this interface. Proper use ensures a control will receive appropriate callbacks notifying it when to initialize styles and invalidate cached values.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.DesignRefresh(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Application Styling Framework(tm) calls this method to notify a control it must refresh its appearance at design-time.
member.param: Flag signifying whether Application Styling has been turned on or off for this control.
Names the ASF style set defining the control's new appearance.
Specifies what the path to the CSS style sheet file is in the new style set for controls of this Type.

remarks.p: The Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) calls this method on controls to notify them of a change in one or more Application Styling properties affecting their appearance. This is an opportunity for the control to invalidate any data it may have cached based on the arguments it receives in this notice.

For example, ASF may call this method to notify a control of a modification having been made to the "web.config" configuration file, or in the style definitions of the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) file for this control and style set.
This property applies at design-time only.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.ResolveImageUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves an image URL at render-time.
member.param: Raw image URL property value to be resolved.
member.returns: Resolved image URL.

remarks.p: The resolution process for image URLs takes into account the , image directory overrides set for the application in the "web.config" file, and style set paths.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.InitializeStyles
member.summary: Application Styling Framework(tm) calls this method to notify a control that it should add it's styles into the style repository.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.StyleSetName
member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the themed appearance for this control.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure a single, consistent, application-wide style set through the styleSetName attribute in their "web.config" file. Alternately, they can define the style set to apply Application Styling to all controls on a Page by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetName property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the style set applied to a single instance of a control.

Normally, graphics designers will furnish you with a style set containing one or more style sheet files (one for each type of control) and image files. The name of the style set (with the exception of the "Default" style set) must appear in each Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name defined by this control's style sheet file. For example, two WebTree controls that each use a different style set, "Aqua" and "Onyx", would expect their CSS class names for the ASF Node role to be "igdt_AquaNode" and "igdt_OnyxNode", respectively. This allows the uniqueness of CSS class names necessary to distinguish multiple style sets for the same type of control, without there being any naming collisions.
Changing the style set name should invalidate any style definitions being cached by at design-time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for this type of control.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure the directory path containing their style set files application-wide by using the styleSetPath attribute of their "web.config" file. It is also possible to configure the style set path applicable to all controls on a Page that are subject to Application Styling by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetPath property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the location of the style set being applied to a single instance of a control.
Changing the style set path should invalidate any style definitions being cached by at design-time.

Be aware that customizing the style set path at the control level will not allow you to copy a style set's files to this new location, changing a few style property values in them, and then use it successfully with separate instances of the control referencing the original style set of the same name. This is because there would be naming collisions in the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class names, which will produce an undefined appearance. You must ensure the CSS class names defined by style sheets in the new style set path are unique from those CSS class names being used by other style sheets that may continue to be referenced. The recommended guidance in this scenario is to create a new style set having a new style set name, that contains your modifications.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.StyleSetPathResolved
member.summary: Gets the resolved path to the current Application Styling Framework(tm) style set.

remarks.p: The property always provides the path the control is using, regardless of whether that path was set at the application-, page- or control-levels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.StyleSheetFileName
member.summary: Default style sheet filename used by the implementing control.
member.value: Filename of the cascading style sheet (CSS) file, with the ".css" extension.

remarks.p: The set method (mutator) of this property is included only for backwards compatibility. Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) does not recognize changes made to this property.
A non-default style sheet filename may be specified if it is done in a fully-qualified .

exception.p: May be thrown by implementations that do not support setting this property.
Implementations are allowed to ignore assignments to this property without throwing an exception.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.StylePrefix
member.summary: Short prefix prepended to each CSS class name associated with controls of this Type.
member.value: String containing the prefix. Conventionally, this prefix ends with an underscore to distinguish it from the ASF style set and role names that are also concatenated into the CSS class name.

remarks.p: The CSS class names that define the style information for each Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) role are made unique by Type of control because every control provides a unique StylePrefix string.

For example, the UltraWebToolbar control specifies it's prefix as "igtb" therefore all CSS class names appearing in the CSS style sheet of it's style sets must start with "igtb_". This allows Application Styling to work on toolbars appearing on the same Web forms with other types of controls (like grids) without CSS class naming collisions for common ASF roles (like the Item role.)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.ImageDirectory
member.summary: A path to the image files for the current style set.

remarks.p: Normally this location will default to the directory containing the style sheet file for the current style set. If assigned independently, the method consults the path you set in ImageDirectory (along with other settings which may override your ImageDirectory) when it returns it's resolved image URLs at render-time.

Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) mandate image URLs appearing as an url() must be inside or beneath the site and directory from which the CSS file was loaded. The browser resolves these url() values in accordance with the CSS specification requirements when it requests the images from the server. This means certain CSS style properties like background-image may not resolve according to your ImageDirectory setting.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.ParsedStyles
member.summary: Keeps a collection of parsed style definitions loaded from external style sheets at design-time.
member.value: A collection of style information parsed from this control's external CSS style sheet file.

remarks.p: The integrated development environment (IDE) does not resolve styles for using Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) files which are linked external from the Web form. Application Styling can only be seen fully at design-time when the control manages for itself the style definitions contained by the style set's CSS style sheet files.
The Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) provides the class to collect style definitions loaded from a CSS style sheet file that has been loaded and parsed by the class.
When a control supporting Application Styling renders at design-time, it must replace the CSS class names that appear in it's design-time markup with their corresponding inline HTML style attributes.
This property applies at design-time only.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.IProvideAppStyling.AppStyleInfo
member.summary: Requests the AppStyleInfo block for the control. This object defines the style roles that can be applied to the control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot.StyleBot
member.summary: Provides the Control with access to style support services provided by the StyleBot class. By separating these services from the control itself, there is no requirement that a particular control must inherit from a specific base class in order to benefit from the services provided.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot.EventList
member.summary: The EventList manages the list of events that need to be fired to the application during the RaisePostDataChangedEvent processing. The list is created during the LoadPostData processing phase. Derived RunBots populate the list as the transactionlists from the client are processed. Derived RunBots iterate the list in the RaiseServerEvents virtual override to fire the actual events.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot.DeferLoadPostDataProcessing
member.summary: Determines if the loading of postback data should be deferred until a later point when the object model is properly restored. This situaion occurs when no ViewState is present and the control must databind first in order to populate the object model.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot.StyleSetName
member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the themed appearance for this control.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure a single, consistent, application-wide style set through the styleSetName attribute in their "web.config" file. Alternately, they can define the style set to apply Application Styling to all controls on a Page by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetName property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the style set applied to a single instance of a control.

Normally, graphics designers will furnish you with a style set containing one or more style sheet files (one for each type of control) and image files. The name of the style set (with the exception of the "Default" style set) must appear in each Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name defined by this control's style sheet file. For example, two WebTree controls that each use a different style set, "Aqua" and "Onyx", would expect their CSS class names for the ASF Node role to be "igdt_AquaNode" and "igdt_OnyxNode", respectively. This allows the uniqueness of CSS class names necessary to distinguish multiple style sets for the same type of control, without there being any naming collisions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot.Infragistics#Web#UI#IProvideAppStyling#StyleSheetFileName
member.summary: File name and path to the CSS stylesheet for this WebControl.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot.Infragistics#Web#UI#IProvideAppStyling#ParsedStyles
member.summary: Contains the ParsedStyleCollection consisting of CSS class definitions read from external sources.
member.value: The ParsedStyleCollection after external CSS class definitions have been parsed, or null (Nothing in Visual Basic .NET) if parsing hasn't been performed yet.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot.EnableAppStyling
member.summary: Enables support on WebTree for the Application Styling Framework(tm).
member.value: True indicates Application Styling is enabled, False indicates Application Styling is disabled, and NotSet indicates support for Application Styling should default to page- or application-level settings.

remarks.p: Turn on support for Application Styling of WebTree when using the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to True.

When EnableAppStyling has it's default value of NotSet, this control will defer the determination of whether to use Application Styling to settings you make at the page- or application-level. Place the WebPage control on the same Web form as this control to configure ASF support for all controls on that Page. ASF support can also be turned on application-wide with the enableAppStyling attribute in your "web.config" file.
Turn off support for the ASF in WebTree (even though it may have been enabled at a higher level) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for this type of control.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure the directory path containing their style set files application-wide by using the styleSetPath attribute of their "web.config" file. It is also possible to configure the style set path applicable to all controls on a Page that are subject to Application Styling by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetPath property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the location of the style set being applied to a single instance of a control.

Be aware that customizing the style set path at the control level will not allow you to copy a style set's files to this new location, changing a few style property values in them, and then use it successfully with separate instances of the control referencing the original style set of the same name. This is because there would be naming collisions in the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class names, which will produce an undefined appearance. You must ensure the CSS class names defined by style sheets in the new style set path are unique from those CSS class names being used by other style sheets that may continue to be referenced. The recommended guidance in this scenario is to create a new style set having a new style set name, that contains your modifications.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RunBot.Infragistics#Web#UI#IProvideAppStyling#StylePrefix
member.summary: Returns a string prefix value that is used within the CSS file to prefix each style class name. Can be overridden to change the prefix used for this control.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.BaseGrid.InstantiateTemplate(Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ITemplatedGridObject,System.Web.UI.ITemplate,System.String)
member.summary: Instantiates any specified templates for a if they have not already been instantiated.
member.remarks: Templates for a ControlDataItem can be instantiated in any one of three ways: 1. The ControlDataItem has a non-null Template property set. 2. The ControlDataItem has a non-empty TemplateId property set. 3. The ControlDataItem belongs to a and it has a non-null ItemTemplate property set. The order and priority of resolution is as described.
member.param: The particular ControlDataItem for template instantiation.
A reference to a default template. If the item has no individual templates this template is used instead.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ControlDataItem.FindControl(System.String)
member.summary: This method searches for a locates control objects within the TemplateContainer associated with this UIObject by using the Id parameter to match against control Ids.
member.param: The string Id value for the control to be located.
member.returns: If a control is located within the TemplateContainer of this UIObject that matches the passed in Id, the control reference is returned. Otherwise null is returned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ControlDataItem.HasTemplate
member.summary: Sets or Gets a boolean value which indicates if a template is applied and instantiated for this item.
member.remarks: This property is checked during the EnsureTemplate call to see if any applicable template has already been applied for this object. If HasTemplate returns false and a template applies to this item, then EnsureTemplate will instantiate the appropriate template.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.ControlDataItem.TemplateContainer
member.summary: This property serves as a holding container for the instantiated template of this UIObject.
member.remarks: Since UIObjects are not derived from WebControl, the TemplateContainer parent is set to the TemplateContainerControl property of the the ControlMain associated with this UIObject. All TemplateContainers for the Control are thereby made children of the TemplateContainerControl so that their ViewState and page lifecycle events can be handled normally.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionUIObject
member.summary: This class represents an object that is a member of a collection of objects. The collection of objects is normally derived from the ObjectCollection base class so the two classes work together to carry out collection related tasks. For the CollectionObject, these tasks include providing and maintaining the Owner ObjectCollection as well as calling the OnAddedToCollection and OnRemovedFromCollection overrides to notify the object when these events occur. This class derives from UIObject so that base class maintains ViewState for the object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionUIObject.#ctor
member.summary: Collection objects should normally be created with an owner parameter in the constructor.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionUIObject.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: CollectionObject constructor that provides an Owner object that can be tracked.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionUIObject.#ctor(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: CollectionObject constructor that provides an Owner object that can be tracked as well as a flag for setting the TrackViewState flag in WebObject.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionUIObject._owner
member.summary: The owner of this object

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionUIObject.OnRemovedFromCollection(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called when this ICollectionObject is being removed from the supplied collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been removed from.

remarks.p: The default implementation of this method nulls out the if the supplied owner matches the Owner of this object.
Inheritors overriding this method should always call this base implementation to assure the object has only one distinct owner.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionUIObject.OnAddedToCollection(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called when this object is being added to the supplied collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been added to.

remarks.p: The default implementation sets the reference to the supplied owner argument, if it hasn't already been set (either the base constructor, or a prior call to should have nullified Owner from any former collection's claim to ownership of this object.)
Inheritors overriding this method should always call this base implementation to assure the object has only one distinct owner.

member.summary: Called when this ICollectionObject has been added to a new collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been added to.

member.summary: Called when this ICollectionObject has been removed from an old collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been removed from.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionUIObject.Owner
member.summary: The primary collection or parent object to which this object belongs.

remarks.p: An ICollectionObject can belong to only one at a time, this is their owner.
Customarily, the base class implementations of the and methods are responsible for detaching this object from its old collection, and attaching it to its new collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ClientEventsBase
member.summary: Base class for ClientSideEvents properties exposed by controls. This object handles the persistence and rendering of client events on behalf of a control. This object also enables the developer to determine if a client event will cause a postback to the server when fired. The GetClientEventNameList method is called by the base class to allow derived classes to add their client events to the list which will be processed at render time.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ClientEventsBase.#ctor(System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create WebObjectBase with required value of isTrackingViewState
member.param: Reference to owner control (optional)

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ClientEventsBase.AddNames(System.String[])
member.summary: Add additional properties the base ClientEvents.
member.param: Names of properties which will be appended to the base list. They should start with the base.NumberOfProperties.

members.member:
Get list of property names which should be used on client.
Items in that list should match with ids used to get/set properties. That method can be overriden only if control modifies/hides properties of base class. Note: that method is called multiple time on any get/set property value. Array of names of all properties.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ClientEventsBase.PostBackAction(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return postback action if client event with a particular name should be posted to server.
member.param: Index of event at which it appears in the GetClientEventNameList()
member.returns: Postback action. Default implementation returns Off.

member.summary: Get value of a property.
member.param: Id of property. That is a constant defined by control which is used as index of property within array returned by GetClientEventNameList().
member.returns: Value of property.

member.summary: Set value of a property with validation for illegal characters.
member.param: Id of property. That is a constant defined by control which is used as index of property within array returned by GetClientEventNameList().
New value for a property

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.RequestFullAsyncRender
member.summary: During internal async post back the method will enable the grid to rerender itself as a whole.
member.remarks: Usually internal async post backs are initiated to update only part of the grid. Calling this method during an async post back will enforce the grid to update its HTML and reinitialize itself entirely as if the page was just loaded.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns
member.summary: Defines whether the grid generates columns automatically during the data binding process.
member.remarks: The grid can automatically generate a column for every field in the data source. If the property is set to True the automatically created columns will be added to the ones set up in the aspx file. If the property is set to False the grid will use only the columns that set up in the aspx file.

member.summary: Contains definition of the grid's columns.
member.remarks: The property is available to be used publicly and is serialized into the aspx file. When the property is set to False all of the columns in the grid are taken from this collection, there is no additionally generated columns in this case.

member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for the headers.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.FooterCaptionCssClass
member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for the footers.
member.remarks: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.ItemCssClass
member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for the cells.

remarks.para: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.
The CSS class name is rendered on the TBODY element and therefore any custom CSS class must have a selector as following: TBODY.[ClassName] TR TD

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.AltItemCssClass
member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for alternative (the ones with even index) rows.

remarks.para: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.
The CSS class name is rendered on the TR element of the alternate rows and therefore any custom CSS class must have a selector as following: TBODY TR.[ClassName] TD

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.SelectedItemCssClass
member.summary: CSS class name that should be used for selected cells.

remarks.para: The CSS class name is rendered down to the client as an addition to currently specified Appliction Style Set class names.

The CSS class name is rendered on the TD element of the cells and there are other CSS class names used to make the grid look good which have selectors, and therefore any custom CSS class must have a selector as following: TBODY TR TD.[ClassName]

member.remarks: Contains definition of all client event handlers that are available on the level of the control.

member.summary: Contains all of the behaviors of the grid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.EnableAjax
member.summary: Determines whether the grid should do Ajax posts when a server side operation is required.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.EnableRelativeLayout
member.summary: Adds position:relative to the style of the grid's scrollable element. This setting enables the grid's templates to host controls that use position:relative in their HTML elements.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDataGrid.EnableDataViewState
member.summary: Turns on separation of data and view of the grid. If the property is False the grid is requesting data from its data source on every post back. That applies to the paged grid as well, so if a page is switched the grid will query the data source twice: once for the current page and once for the new page. If the property is True the data is requested once on initial load. Only current page is placed in the view state if paging is enabled, meaning the grid will be requesting new page anyway of data if the page is switched.

member.summary: New values. The hashtable consists of the new values to be set on the row cells. The hash key is the key of corresponding column and the value is the new value to be set. If the vlaues are alternated in the hashtable they are applied to the grid and carried over to the data source as well.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.RowUpdatingEventArgs.OldValues
member.summary: Old values. The hashtable contains former values of the row's cells. If the grid contains templated columns or is bound to some of the fields from the data source, the Values and OldValues must be updated to add those missing values. Otherwise missing cells will be nulled out by the auto update operation.

member.summary: Java Script pattern to get value from the contol defined in the property.

remarks.para: The string in this property is an encoded string some parts of which will be replaced before they are brought to the client and used. Supported matches:

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridBehaviorContainer
member.summary: The class defines a grid behavior container. Such a container allows creating hierarchies of behaviors and having certain behaviors to be made children of others.
member.remarks: The behavior container is inheriting its capabilities from a simple behavior therefore it has all of the fetaures of a behavior but has an ability to pass all of the events and service method invokations down to its children.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridBehaviorContainer.OnLoad
member.summary: Overrides loading of the behavior. Passes the method call down to its children.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridBehaviorContainer.OnUnload
member.summary: Overrides unlloading of the behavior. Passes the method call down to its children.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridBehaviorContainer.CreateBehaviors
member.summary: The method is called whenevr the child behavior collection must be created.

member.summary: When implemented by a derived class the method returns a reference to the child behaviors collection.
member.returns: Child behaviors collection.

member.summary: Ensures that the behavior container has proper references to its owner control.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebCalendarProvider.Culture
member.summary: The object used by the control.

remarks.p:
The Culture property allows to customize all aspects of format that is applied to a DateTime object while converting it to string. Those format properties include field separators, date/time patterns, names of months, etc.
If value is not set, then the System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture object is used.
The only Gregorian calendar is supported.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDateChooserProvider.Culture
member.summary: The object used by the control.

remarks.p:
The Culture property allows to customize all aspects of format that is applied to a DateTime object while converting it to string. Those format properties include field separators, date/time patterns, names of months, etc.
If value is not set, then the System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture object is used.
Abbriviated month names in edit mode are not supported and months are converted to digits. The only Gregorian calendar is supported.

member.summary: Type of object that is used to wrap the Value property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDateTimeEditProvider.EditModeFormat
member.summary: Format of date used for edit mode.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the "d". If string has length of 1 (single flag-character such as: d, f, g, s, etc.), then the System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture is used to obtain date pattern. Otherwise, this property is treated as explicit date pattern.
Example of explicit pattern: "dd-MM-yyyy" To learn about format flags and patterns, see documentation for the System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo class.
Note The "z" and "g" characters and "%c" style in pattern are ignored. Possible day of the week field is ignored, and abbriviated month name is converted to digit.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDateTimeEditProvider.PromptChar
member.summary: Character that is used to fill missing date fields while control has focus.
member.remarks: Default value is set to the underscore '_' character.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDateTimeEditProvider.YearToFillCentury
member.summary: Value that is used to autofill year field to the 20th or 21st century if only 1 or 2 digits are entered.

remarks.p: Range of values: from -1 to 99.
If value is set to -1, then autofill is disabled.
If entered year is less or equal to the value of that property, then 2000 is added to the year field.
If entered year is larger than the value of that property and less than 100, then 1900 is added to the year field.
Default value is 29.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDateTimeEditProvider.Culture
member.summary: The object used by the control.

remarks.p: The Culture property allows to customize all aspects of format that is applied to date value while converting it to string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDateTimeEditProvider.SpinButtonsDelta
member.summary: Value that is used to increment/decrement editing value on spin events.

remarks.p: That value is also used when increment/decrement happens on the up/down arrow keys.
In case of zero, the value of 1 of the field where caret was is used.
Default value is set to 1 day for date editor, 1 minute for time editor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebDateTimeEditProvider.SpinButtonsWidth
member.summary: Width of spin buttons excluding borders.

remarks.p: If button has image, then width can not be smaller than the width of image.
If value is not set, then 12 pixel is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebMaskEditProvider.InputMask
member.summary: Input mask used to filter keyboard entries.
member.remarks:
Default value is set to "CCCCCCCCCCCC".
The mask may contain literal characters and input-mask-flags such as
& - any keyboard character (entry is required)
L - letter (entry is required)
0, # - digit (entry is required)
A - letter or digit (entry is required)
C - any keyboard character (entry is optional)
? - letter (entry is optional)
9 - digit (entry is optional)
a - letter or digit (entry is optional)
> - all letters to the right are converted to the upper case
< - all letters to the right are converted to the lower case
For information on how to customize input masks, see the following topic section of the help: Developer's Guide > The Toolset > Controls and Components > WebMaskEdit.
Notes:
If in front of any flag-character appears the "\" (escape) character, then that character becomes the literal part of mask. For example, if mask is set to the "A\A\BB\\##\99" and control has no data, then text in edit mode will appear as "_A\BB\#_9_". Where the "_" are available positions for entry.
To cancel upper/lower case convertion which was set by the > or < flag, that flag should be used one more time. For example, if mask is set to the ">CC->CC->CC" and user entered the "XxXxXx", then resulting text should appear as "XX-Xx-XX".
While control has no input focus, the optional empty mask positions are not displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebMaskEditProvider.PromptChar
member.summary: Character that is used to fill empty mask positions in the display text while the control has focus.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the '_' (underscore) character.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebMaskEditProvider.EmptyPositionChar
member.summary: Character that is used to replace empty (not filled) positions in the InputMask while building string returned by Value property.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the Space character.
This property is designed for situation when empty position characters expected by application (database) would be confusing if used as prompts. For example '?' or '0' characters.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.WebMaskEditProvider.DataMode
member.summary: Specifies rules that are used to get/set the property.

remarks.p:
Those rules define various combinations of the following conditions:
Whether or not the literal characters (not editable part of mask) should be included.
Whether or not the required empty mask positions should be included.
Whether or not the optional empty mask positions should be included.
Default value is set to 'RawTextWithRequiredPrompts'. This property is designed to be used when this editor is embedded into grid or other control.

Note: When literal characters are included and the value is set, then characters in that new value which positions match with the positions of the literal characters in mask are ignored. Though, those "dummy" characters should be present in the value, otherwise, the "data" characters will be lost and may appear shifted to wrong positions.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.MaskDataMode
member.summary: The approach that used to build string for the Value property of the WebMaskEditProvider control.

member.summary: Raw text with empty required prompt-mask positions replaced by the EmptyPositionChar characters. No empty optional prompt-mask positions and no literal-mask characters.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.MaskDataMode.RawTextWithAllPrompts
member.summary: Raw text with all empty prompt-mask positions replaced by the EmptyPositionChar characters. No literal-mask characters.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.MaskDataMode.RawTextWithLiterals
member.summary: Raw text with literal-mask characters. No empty prompt-mask positions.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.IRowSelectorsBehavior
member.summary: Interface for RowSelector behavior.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.IRowSelectorsBehavior.AddSelectorImage(Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.GridRecord,System.String)
member.summary: Add a css class containing a new image to the row selector's image area.

remarks.p: This method is designed for other behaviors to use. It shouldn't be necessary to use it otherwise.

The images on the row selector are set using CSS classes. The classes will be applied to a div element inside the row selector. It's recommended that you don't set padding or borders in your css or it will distort the width and height of the row selector. Your style will need to set an appropriate width and height to display the image.
If mutiple css classes are applied, the resolution will be up to the browser depending on the order that the classes are declared in.

member.param: The row that the row selector belongs to
The css class to apply

remarks.p: This method is designed for other behaviors to use. It shouldn't be necessary to use it otherwise.

member.param: The row that the row selector belongs to
The css class to apply

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.PropCount
member.summary: Returns the total number of properties on the object that should go to the client.. This should be calculated by taking the amount of Properties on the base class plus the amount of properties on this class. If you are deriving from this object and need to add additional client properties, you must override this property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.CellClickAction
member.summary: Returns/sets the action that will occur when a cell is clicked on the WebDataGrid.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.CellSelectType
member.summary:
Determines how many cells can be selected at any given time.
Note: this property relates only to the UI functionality. Cells can still be selected via the API.
None - Cells will not be selected.
Single - Only one cell can be selected at a time.
Multiple - More than one cell can be selected at the same time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.RowSelectType
member.summary:
Determines how many rows can be selected at any given time.
Note: this property relates only to the UI functionality. Rows can still be selected via the API.
None - Rows will not be selected.
Single - Only one row can be selected at a time.
Multiple - More than one row can be selected at the same time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.ColumnSelectType
member.summary:
Determines how many columns can be selected at any given time.
Note: this property relates only to the UI functionality. Columns can still be selected via the API.
None - Columns will not be selected.
Single - Only one column can be selected at a time.
Multiple - More than one column can be selected at the same time.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.SelectedCells
member.summary:
A collection of cells that are currently selected in the WebDataGrid.
To select a cell, use the Add method off of the Collection.
To unselect a cell, use the Remove method off of the Collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.SelectedRows
member.summary:

To select a row, use the Add method off of the Collection.
To unselect a row, use the Remove method off of the Collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.GridControls.Selection.SelectedColumns

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RendererBase
member.summary: The principle base class for implementation of the Visitor pattern for rendering markup. This base class contains context information and utility methods to support rendering methods that output markup to the HtmlTextWriter. This class is used by control developers only as a base class for specific rendering implementations.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RendererBase.AddXAttribute(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Writes an attribute string to the specified HtmlTextWriter. The string is initially encoded into the id atttribute and to conform to XHTML standards, and is then decoded on the client and applied as an attribute to the corresponding element. Note: If not DesignMode, then before call to that method owner of this RunBot should call InitializeXAttributes() before every Render.
member.param: The HtmlTextWriter where the attribute will be added.
The string name of the attribute.
The value of the attribute to be written.

Original value for class attribute used by control
Attribute marker
Value for attribute marker

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection
member.summary: This class encapsulates the functionality of managing a collection of objects that are part of a series of collections arranged in a tree structure. The class exposes a series of methods that serve to abstract the basic collection operations to allow for collection manipulation independant of the concrete classes that are derived from it.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.CreateCollectionObject(System.String)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Creates a collection object based on an object type identifier. This method is called by the LoadViewState method to create objects of the appropriate type as view state is reloaded.
member.param: The type of the collection object to be created as determined by the string identifier.
member.returns: Returns an object that implements ICollectionObject.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.CreateItem
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Factory method called when an object for the collection needs to be created. The default implementation calls the main object factory of HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain where the call is routed to the most derived control class which determines the type of item to create for the collection.
member.returns: A HierarchicalUIObject of the appropriate type.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Add
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. A generic method used to add an item derived from HierarchicalUIObject to the collection. This method first calls the CreateItem method which routes the call to the main control where the appropriate object type is created. This object is then added to the collection.
member.returns: A HierarchicalUIObject of the appropriate type.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Move(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. This method moves the specified item within the collection from it's current position to the position specified by the index parameter. The movement of the item is tracked by the framework so that it can be re positioned each time a page post back occurs.
member.param: A reference to the item to be moved.
The new position index for the item being moved.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Insert(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. A generic method used to insert an item derived from HierarchicalUIObject to the collection. This method first calls the CreateItem method which routes the call to the main control where the appropriate object type is created. This object is then inserted into the collection at the specified index.
member.param: The position index where the newly created item will be inserted.
member.returns: A HierarchicalUIObject of the appropriate type.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Remove(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject)
member.summary: Removes the specified item from the collection
member.param: A reference to the item to be removed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.OnInsertComplete(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Called by the framework when an object has been inserted, or added, to the collection. This method ensures that the inserted object has the appropriate owner assigned to it.
member.param: The index at which the object was inserted.
A reference to the object that was inserted.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the HierarchicalUIObject within the collection that corresponds to the supplied index.
member.param: The integer offset for the object within the collection to be deleted

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. This property gets a reference to the ControlMain object that ownes this collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Owner
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Each HierarchicalObjectCollection is owned by a HierarchicalUIObject. For example, a Nodes collection in a Tree is owned by a particular Node. The owner Node is then the Parent of each Node within the HierarchicalObjectCollection. The nodes at the root level of the tree are owned by a hidden Owner which is also referred to as the RootItem. In this way, the tree of HierarchicalObjectCollections is referred to as being single rooted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalObjectCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is used primarily by control developers and derivations of existing controls. Indexer for the HierarchicalObjectCollection
member.param: The integer offset for the requested object within the collection
member.returns: The HierarchicalUIObject that corresponds to the supplied index.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.RootItem
member.summary: This class is used as a container for the Topmost Items collection in an object hierarchy. There is only one of these created for each HierarchicalDataBoundControl. This object automatically gets created by the control at initialization so that the actual hierarchical items can be hung off of it.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject
member.summary:
This class serves as the base class for items that are contained in a hierarchical tree structure and which are also data bound. The properties that relate to Hierarchical items are: HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain Index Level FullAddress ParentItem Owner InnerItems HasChildren
The properties that relate to DataBindings are: DataPath Populated DataItem

member.summary: This method returns a boolean value that indicates if the object is an ancestor of the item passed in.
member.param: Reference to the item that might be a descendant of this.
member.returns: true if this is an ancestor of the passed in item. False otherwise.

member.summary: Helper method for IsAncestorOf method

member.summary: This method returns a boolean value that indicates if the object is a descendant of the item passed in.
member.param: Reference to the item that might be an ancestor of this.
member.returns: true if this object is a descendant of the passed in item. False otherwise.

member.summary: Sets or gets a string value representing the datapath into the data source used to popuplate the children of this item (if any).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.HierarchicalDataBoundControlMain
member.summary: Returns a reference to the primary control that owns this collection object

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.Index
member.summary: Returns the index of this collection object within its owning collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.Level
member.summary: Returns the hierarchical level of this collection object within the tree structure.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.FullAddress
member.summary: Returns a delimited string representation of this collection object within the tree structure. Each object in the tree is thereby uniquely identified using a unique string representation. For example, "0.0" represents the first child of the first item in the tree. "1.1" represents the second child of the second item in the tree and so forth. "1.2.3" represents the fourth child of the third child of the second item in the tree. The FullAddress property is used to link data to items in the tree on the client and syncronizing such changes across post backs.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.ParentItem
member.summary: Returns a reference to the Parent of this item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.Owner
member.summary: Returns a reference to the collection that owns this object

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.InnerItems
member.summary: Contains the inner implementation of the Items collection for an item. The derived class can expose or not expose an Items or Nodes collection as it sees fit based on this inner collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.HasChildren
member.summary: Returns a boolean value that indicates if this object has children within the tree hierarchy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.HierarchicalUIObject.PropCount
member.summary: Returns the number of client properties managed by this object.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionControlObject
member.summary: This class represents a WebControl object that is a member of a collection of objects. The collection of objects would be derived from the ObjectCollection base class so the two classes work together to carry out collection related tasks. For the CollectionControlObject, these tasks include providing and maintaining the Owner ObjectCollection as well as calling the OnAddedToCollection a and OnRemovedFromCollection overrides to notify the object when these events occur. This class derives from ControlObject so that base class maintains ViewState for the object. The ID property of this class overrides the ID property to prevent it from being set because for Templates, the ID must be managed by the framework.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ControlObject
member.summary: This class forms the base for objects which need to derive from WebControl. It implements templating support, viewstate getters and setters, clientstate support as well as support for uiFlags.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionControlObject.OnRemovedFromCollection(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called when this object is being removed from the supplied collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been removed from.

remarks.p: The default implementation of this method nulls out the if the supplied primaryCollection matches the primary collection of this object.
Inheritors overriding this method should always call this base implementation to assure the object has only one distinct primary collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionControlObject.OnAddedToCollection(Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: Called when this object is being added to the supplied collection.
member.param: Collection that this object has been added to.

remarks.p: The default implementation sets the reference to the supplied primaryCollection argument, if it hasn't already been set (either the base constructor, or a prior call to should have nullified PrimaryCollection from any former collection's claim to ownership of this object.)
Inheritors overriding this method should always call this base implementation to assure the object has only one distinct primary collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.CollectionControlObject.Owner
member.summary: The primary collection or parent object to which this object belongs.

remarks.p: A CollectionControlObject can belong to only one ObjectCollectionBase at a time, this is their primary collection. Inheritors subclassing KeyedObjectBase may use this property in exposing their own subclass of KeyedObjectCollectionBase offering additional capabilities.
Customarily, the base class implementations of the and methods are responsible for detaching this object from its old collection, and attaching it to its new collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.LayoutPane.EnableRelativeLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the request to render relative position for content.

remarks.p: Notes: That property is designed to get around differences in behavior of different browsers, when child elements of content have relative or absolute positions. It is recommended to enable that property when child controls or parts of html generated by them use position:relative or position:absolute. For example, WebImageViewer uses position:relative style attribute, and therefore, it may fail to be scrolled in IE or it may go out of content bounds in other browsers.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ControlMain.StyleBot
member.summary: Provides the Control with access to style support services provided by the StyleBot class. By separating these services from the control itself, there is no requirement that a particular control must inherit from a specific base class in order to benefit from the services provided.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ControlMain.StyleSetName
member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the themed appearance for this control.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure a single, consistent, application-wide style set through the styleSetName attribute in their "web.config" file. Alternately, they can define the style set to apply Application Styling to all controls on a Page by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetName property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the style set applied to a single instance of a control.

Normally, graphics designers will furnish you with a style set containing one or more style sheet files (one for each type of control) and image files. The name of the style set (with the exception of the "Default" style set) must appear in each Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name defined by this control's style sheet file. For example, two WebTree controls that each use a different style set, "Aqua" and "Onyx", would expect their CSS class names for the ASF Node role to be "igdt_AquaNode" and "igdt_OnyxNode", respectively. This allows the uniqueness of CSS class names necessary to distinguish multiple style sets for the same type of control, without there being any naming collisions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.Framework.ControlMain.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for this type of control.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure the directory path containing their style set files application-wide by using the styleSetPath attribute of their "web.config" file. It is also possible to configure the style set path applicable to all controls on a Page that are subject to Application Styling by placing a WebPage control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetPath property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the location of the style set being applied to a single instance of a control.

Be aware that customizing the style set path at the control level will not allow you to copy a style set's files to this new location, changing a few style property values in them, and then use it successfully with separate instances of the control referencing the original style set of the same name. This is because there would be naming collisions in the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class names, which will produce an undefined appearance. You must ensure the CSS class names defined by style sheets in the new style set path are unique from those CSS class names being used by other style sheets that may continue to be referenced. The recommended guidance in this scenario is to create a new style set having a new style set name, that contains your modifications.

member.summary: Gets sets the initial location of WebDialogWindow relative to window of browser.
member.remarks: That property has no effect if Header.PinBox.Pressed or Header.MaximizeBox.Pressed is true. If value is set to Centered, then the Left and Top properties will be adjusted for the instant scroll of page within browser window.

member.summary: Class used by WebSplitter for their splitter panes.

member.summary: Pass server properties to client.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.Visible
member.summary: Not supported property

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.CssClass
member.summary: Css class applied to the DIV element used to render content of this pane.
member.remarks: Note: The class should not contain any attribute related to border or padding, otherwise it may break apperance of control

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.Collapsed
member.summary: Gets sets collapsed or expanded state of pane.
member.remarks: Default state of pane expanded and value of that property is false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.CollapsedDirection
member.summary: Gets sets the location of a button on a splitter bar which allows to collapse or expand this pane.
member.remarks:
If this is the first pane in the Panes collection of the WebSplitter and that property is set to NextPane, then the PreviousPane value is used.
If this is the last pane in the Panes collection of the WebSplitter and that property is set to PreviousPane, then the NextPane value is used.
If this is the only pane in the Panes collection of the WebSplitter, then that property has no effect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.Locked
member.summary: Gets sets ability to enable or disable resizing of this pane by mouse.

member.summary: Gets sets maximum width of SplitterPane if WebSplitter.Orientation is Vertical, or maximum height if Orientation is Horizontal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.MinSize
member.summary: Gets sets minimum width of SplitterPane if WebSplitter.Orientation is Vertical, or minimum height if Orientation is Horizontal.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane.Size
member.summary: Gets sets initial width of SplitterPane for vertical orientation of initial height for horizontal orientation.

member.summary: Render splitter pane. That method should render the DIV inside of the TD element.

Not null instance of SplitterPane
Index of pane according to its order in html.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterRenderer.RenderSplitBar(System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter,Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.SplitterPane,System.Int32,System.Boolean,Infragistics.Web.UI.DefaultableBoolean,Infragistics.Web.UI.DefaultableBoolean)
member.summary: Render splitbar.

Not null instance of SplitterPane
Index of pane according to its order in html.
True: horizontal split (rows of table). False: vertical split (columns of table)

True or NotSet: draw collapsable-button for next pane. True: pane is in collapsed state.

True: horizontal split, false: vertical split

True: pane is collapsed

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebSplitter.AutoPostBackFlags
member.summary: Gets reference to container for properties that are related to the auto postback options supported by WebSplitter.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebSplitter.Panes
member.summary: Gets reference to collection of SplitterPanes.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebSplitter.Collapsed
member.summary: Adds removes event handler which is fired after a SplitterPane was collapsed.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebSplitter.Expanded
member.summary: Adds removes event handler which is fired after a SplitterPane was expanded.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebSplitter.SplitterPaneSizeChanged
member.summary: Adds removes event handler which is fired after value of SplitterPane.Size property was changed by client.
member.remarks:
The value of that property can be changed due to various reasons. Examples:
Property was not set on intialization
Size of SplitterPane was modified by collapse/expand action of other pane
Splitter bar was moved by end user
WebSplitter was resized by its container
etc.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Web.UI.LayoutControls.WebSplitter.SplitterBarPositionChanged
member.summary: Adds removes event handler which is fired after position of splitter bar was changed.
member.remarks: That event is raised only if AutoPostBackFlags.SplitterBarPositionChanged property is set to On or Async.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles
member.summary: Roles defined for the ig_imageviewer.css file.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.Control
member.summary:
The CSS Class that will be applied to the outer control.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderPadding
member.summary:
The CSS Class that will be applied to the outer control when the Header is Visible.
This class should be used for setting any padding that might be needed if the Header is placed above the control.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderContentArea
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the header.
The header can be absolutely positoned anywhere in the control, because the WebImageViewer has an internal DIV that wraps the control with a position set to relative.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderContentLeft
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Left Corner of the Header.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderContent
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the actual content of the Header.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderContentRight
member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Right Corner of the Header.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.HeaderArea
member.summary:
A TR that wraps the TopLeft, TopArea, and TopRight elements.
This CSS class is useful in setting the height of the entire row.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.FooterPadding
member.summary:
The CSS Class that will be applied to the outer control when the Footer is Visible.
This class should be used for adjusting the padding of the control,to account for the additional size of the header and footer.
Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.UI.ListControls.ImageViewerRoles.FooterContentArea
member.summary:

Applied when Orientation is set to Horizontal.

member.summary:
The CSS class that will be applied to the Left Corner of the Footer.
